intro: Gymnopentzia bifurcata, commonly known as the bifurcated penta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bifurcated leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. Its roots are known for their medicinal properties, used traditionally in local remedies. Gymnopentzia bifurcata thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
